data.title: All the Canceled and Renewed TV Shows in April 2024
data.meta_description: Here are all the shows that have been canceled or renewed by networks, cable channels, and streaming services in April 2024, including ABC dramas Grey's Anatomy and 9-1-1 and NBC's Quantum Leap.
data.text:
April is generally the month of rebirth, as spring brings the renewal of flowers, baby animals, and warm weather, but what about television? Which television shows burst through the soil with new life in April, and which were forever buried? Our list of all the canceled and renewed shows in April will tell you. The month brought some of the biggest renewals of 2024: ABC's 9-1-1, just weeks after its debut on the network, was thrown a lifeline and will return for Season 8 next year; Grey's Anatomy is scrubbing in for Season 21; and The Rookie will be back for Season 7. CBS also had a big month, with renewals of Elsbeth, NCIS, The Neighborhood, The Equalizer, all three FBI series, and S.W.A.T. â€” yes, the same S.W.A.T. that was already canceled once and then brought back for what was supposed to be its final season. Apple TV+'s Monarch: Legacy of Monsters and For All Mankind were also renewed, and so was Paramount+'s Star Trek: Strange New Worlds. Netflix renewed its hit fantasy series The Witcher for a fifth and final season, and Prime Video announced the renewal of the video game adaptation Fallout.

But it was bad news for Star Trek: Lower Decks, which will end with its fifth season, as well as NBC's Quantum Leap, which has been canceled after two seasons. CBS also dropped the axe on CSI: Vegas, NCIS: Hawai'i, and So Help Me Todd.

Whether you're looking to celebrate more of your favorites or mourn the loss of something on your regular rotation, we're keeping tabs on all the shows that have been canceled or renewed this month below.

May's renewals and cancellations

March's renewals and cancellations

TV show cancellations

NCIS: Hawai'i, CBS: Aloha, in this case, means goodbye. CBS has canceled the island-set spin-off after three seasons. The series finale airs May 6. (April 26, Deadline)

Run the Burbs, The CW: Andrew Phung's family comedy was canceled by Canada's CBC after three seasons. Two seasons aired on The CW as part of the network's initiative to import series during its transition to a new business strategy. It is not known if or when Season 3 will air on The CW, the CW app, or cwtv.com. (April 26, Deadline)

CSI: Vegas, CBS: The newest iteration of the popular franchise will not be returning for Season 4 despite solid ratings. (April 19, Deadline)

So Help Me Todd, CBS: Marcia Gay Harden and Skyler Astin's light drama was canceled after two seasons even though it had better ratings than several shows on other networks. CBS has a higher bar. (April 19, Deadline)

Star Trek: Lower Decks, Paramount+: The upcoming fifth season will be the last for the animated Star Trek series. (April 12, Paramount+)

Quantum Leap, NBC: NBC's time-hopping drama, a reboot of the late '80s/early '90s series, has been canceled after two seasons. (April 5, Deadline)
